subject: Gardening
title: The Controversy of Plant Consciousness
description: A quick, practical guide to The Controversy of Plant Consciousness.

hook.text: In 2006, a paper proposed 'plant neurobiology' as a field. The backlash from scientists was immediate.

buildup.text: Proponents argue that plants process information, communicate, and adaptâ€”hallmarks of intelligence.

discovery.text: Critics say intelligence requires a brain. Labeling plant responses 'intelligent' anthropomorphizes basic chemistry.

twist.text: Both sides agree on the factsâ€”plants do remarkable things. The fight is over what words we use to describe them.

climax.text: The debate reveals more about human bias than plant capability. We define intelligence by our own blueprint.

punchline.text: The argument isn't what plants doâ€”it's what we call it.

quiz.question: What is the core disagreement in the plant intelligence debate?
options: Whether plants can photosynthesize efficiently enough to be called intelligent
Whether plant information processing constitutes intelligence or is just chemistry
Whether plants evolved before or after animals developed brains
